metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2816 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
Out-of-bounds Read in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0212.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> the faulty method check_vim9_unlet was added in version 8.2.0601 with commit d72c1bf0a, so, versions earlier than that are not affected.

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.11').
